content.raw:
There seems to be a problem with the current Xenial build: [https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/ignition\_sensors-ci-default-xenial-amd64/1/console](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/ignition_sensors-ci-default-xenial-amd64/1/console)

A port from this, with the DSL code present here we are going to generate a good bunch of jobs. I'm not sure if we are ready for having:

* Windows and Homebrew jobs
* Install jobs for packages in the different Ubuntu flavours

I prefer not to have failing jobs in Jenkins so it would be nice to disable all the options that we can not have working before merging the PR.  We should probably have done the same for ign\_gui, feel free to do it in this PR for those of the ign\_gui jobs currently failing.
content.html:
There seems to be a problem with the current Xenial build: https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/ignition_sensors-ci-default-xenial-amd64/1/console

A port from this, with the DSL code present here we are going to generate a good bunch of jobs. I'm not sure if we are ready for having:

  • Windows and Homebrew jobs
  • Install jobs for packages in the different Ubuntu flavours

I prefer not to have failing jobs in Jenkins so it would be nice to disable all the options that we can not have working before merging the PR. We should probably have done the same for ign_gui, feel free to do it in this PR for those of the ign_gui jobs currently failing.

content.raw: @scpeters @mxgrey for implementing the Windows CI for ign\_sensors, which is the current model I need to follow?
content.html: @scpeters @mxgrey for implementing the Windows CI for ign_sensors, which is the current model I need to follow?

content.raw:
You can use `ign-common` as a blueprint.

First, in `release-tools/jenkins-scripts`, create `ign_sensors-default-devel-windows-amd64.bat`, and make it look like [ign_common-default-devel-windows-amd64.bat](#!/osrf/release-tools/src/323f44868479d2537e58c3869ab6172b21534815/jenkins-scripts/ign_common-default-devel-windows-amd64.bat?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default), but replace the line `set VCS_DIRECTORY=ign-common` with `set VCS_DIRECTORY=ign-sensors`. That should be the only difference.

Then, in [ign-sensors/configure.bat](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-sensors/src/6d77a539caae2801fe4df057a9240da73eb99563/configure.bat?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default), make it look like [ign-common/configure.bat](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-common/src/7a9b1ee092b5e7419722cd9de5dd205a56c09fba/configure.bat?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default), except you can remove line 7 since `ign-sensors` doesn't need `dl-win32`. You'll also want to remove line 8 and replace it with:

```
call %win_lib% :install_ign_project ign-transport
call %win_lib% :install_ign_project ign-common
call %win_lib% :install_ign_project ign-rendering
```

However, this assumes that `ign-transport` and `ign-rendering` both have `ign-cmake` support and follow this Windows CI, which is not the case yet. We'll need to update those dependencies to the new Windows CI procedure before we can get it going on `ign-sensors`.
content.html:
You can use ign-common as a blueprint.

First, in release-tools/jenkins-scripts, create ign_sensors-default-devel-windows-amd64.bat, and make it look like ign_common-default-devel-windows-amd64.bat, but replace the line set VCS_DIRECTORY=ign-common with set VCS_DIRECTORY=ign-sensors. That should be the only difference.

Then, in ign-sensors/configure.bat, make it look like ign-common/configure.bat, except you can remove line 7 since ign-sensors doesn't need dl-win32. You'll also want to remove line 8 and replace it with:

call %win_lib% :install_ign_project ign-transport
call %win_lib% :install_ign_project ign-common
call %win_lib% :install_ign_project ign-rendering

However, this assumes that ign-transport and ign-rendering both have ign-cmake support and follow this Windows CI, which is not the case yet. We'll need to update those dependencies to the new Windows CI procedure before we can get it going on ign-sensors.

content.raw: Although we need to wait for Windows, I'm going to merge this PR and enable the CI for Linux and Brew now.
content.html: Although we need to wait for Windows, I'm going to merge this PR and enable the CI for Linux and Brew now.
